result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.
Defendant in court with Attorney Jason C. Gonzalez.  Rachel E. Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Status conference on July 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
  - Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
  - Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 1.  Status conference scheduled for 07-28-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in court with Attorney Jason C Gonzalez.  Timothy J Helmberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.
Initial appearance on June 26, 2014 at 10:30 am.
